question:
Which of the following are the effects of air pollution on vegetation?
1) It retards photosynthesis.
2) Sulphur dioxide causes chlorosis, plasmolysis, membrane damage and metabolic inhibition
3) Hydrocarbons such as ethylene cause premature leaf fall, fruit drop, etc;
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Air pollution not only affects human health but also affects vegetation a lot. It retards photosynthesis. Sulphur dioxide causes chlorosis, plasmolysis, membrane damage and metabolic inhibition and Hydrocarbons such as ethylene cause premature leaf fall, fruit drop, etc;
